	The Social Media Manager &amp; Content Creator Executive will be responsible for managing the organization&rsquo;s social media presence, developing and executing content plans, and creating high-quality digital content.

Social Media Manager & Content Creator Executive Job at ReelFruit




        
    

        
        ReelFruit, founded in 2012, is the market leader in the healthy snack category, pioneering the introduction of healthy dried fruit as a snack in the Nigerian market. The company was founded on a mission to build a scalable agribusiness to add value to the local fruit value chain, produced, package and distribute locally made snacks that could sit on any shelf in the world!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager & Content Creator Executive

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Social Media Manager & Content Creator Executive will be responsible for managing the organization’s social media presence, developing and executing content plans, and creating high-quality digital content.
	The role requires strong copywriting skills, analytical capability, and hands-on experience in video content creation to support brand visibility and engagement.


Duties and Responsibilities
Social Media Management & Execution:


	Manage and maintain the company’s social media platforms in line with brand objectives and guidelines.
	Plan, schedule, and publish content across all assigned platforms.
	Monitors comments, messages, and mentions, ensuring timely and professional engagement.
	Ensure brand tone, visual identity, and messaging are consistently applied across all social media outputs.


Content Planning & Creation:


	Develop and manage a structured content calendar aligned with campaigns, product launches, and key marketing activities.
	Create engaging social media content, with a strong focus on short-form video content (Reels, TikTok, Shorts).
	Write clear, compelling, and brand-aligned copy for captions, hooks, and calls-to-action.
	Work closely with internal teams or external partners to deliver content requirements where necessary.


Analytics & Performance Reporting:


	Track and analyze social media performance using platform insights and analytics tools.
	Prepare periodic performance reports highlighting engagement, reach, growth, and key insights.
	Use data and insights to recommend improvements to content strategy and execution.


Administrative & Team Support:


	Maintain an organized digital content calendar, deadlines, and posting schedules.
	Manage documentation related to content plans, approvals, and reports.
	Support the Brand and Marketing team on digital campaigns, launches, and other brand initiatives as required.
	Provide general support to the Brand Manager on assigned digital and content-related tasks.


Educational Qualifications, Experience & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Mass Communication, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in social media management or digital content roles
	Strong written communication and copywriting skills
	Demonstrated experience in video content creation and editing
	Ability to analyze social media metrics and report performance
	Strong organizational and time-management skills
	Ability to think creatively and respond swiftly in dynamic situations; proactive and open-minded.

HR & Legal Manager (FMCG) Job at Ascentech Services Limited




        
    

        
        Ascentech Services Limited is the most sought-after Human Resource Solution Provider with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing clients expectations through our core offerings: Recruitment and Selection, Outsourcing, Training and Development. To accomplish these we leverage on creating and managing change in organizations by improving efficiency through our proven and dynamic HR solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR & Legal Manager (FMCG)

Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Monitor and audit HR policies and practices to ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.
	Developing Compliance Programs: Creating and maintaining robust HR compliance frameworks.
	Conducting Audits: Regularly reviewing HR practices and documentation for compliance.
	Monitoring Legal Changes: Keeping track of updates in employment laws and regulations.
	Providing Training: Educating the HR team and management on compliance issues.
	Managing Risks: Implementing strategies to mitigate risks related to employment law.
	Verify that all firm and regulatory policies and procedures have been documented, implemented, and communicated.
	Investigating Violations: Addressing and resolving potential compliance breaches.
	Reporting: Preparing detailed compliance reports and maintaining necessary documentation.
	Equal Employment Opportunity: Ensuring the proper implementation of EEO guidelines.
	Advising Leadership: Offering insights on potential legal and regulatory risks to senior management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Law, Business Administration, or a related field
	Experience: 5- 7 years in HR compliance.
	Knowledge: In-depth understanding of employment laws and regulations.
	Proficiency in HR information systems (HRIS) or compliance management software.
	Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and advanced proficiency in HR information systems.
	Certification: Professional HR certification (SHRM-CP or PHR preferred).


Salary
N1,000,000 - N1,200,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@ascentech.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
